alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Union; Western Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 12:23PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Slow moving thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Bradford, southern Baker, eastern Union and northwestern Clay Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1221 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow moving thunderstorms that were producing torrential downpours over Raiford, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Butler, Raiford, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Sanderson, Beasley, Lawtey, Ellerbee and Johnstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
